data.title: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation
data.meta_description: Group Companies - Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation is a leading global bank.
data.text:
Profiles of Major Group Companies

SMBC Trust Bank Ltd.

(Link to SMBC Trust Bank Ltd. Website.)

SMBC Trust Bank was founded in February 1986 as Chemical Trust Bank (and then operated as Societe Generale Private Banking Japan Ltd.). As well as our corporate trust operations, we have worked to develop personalized retail banking and asset management operations that utilize trust systems and functions. SMBC Trust Bank became part of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group in October 2013. We are now making a fresh start following the integration of the retail banking operations of Citibank Japan Ltd. under the new PRESTIA brand in November 2015.

SMBC Trust Bank service will be offered to a customer by combining our high-level expertise and experience in trust services, built up through our track record in this area, with the extensive information capabilities and solid organizational skills of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group.

Head offices: Nishi-Shimbashi Square 19F, Nishi-Shimbashi 1-3-1, Minato-ku, Tokyo 105-0003

PayPay Bank Corporation

(Link to PayPay Bank Corporation Website.)

PayPay Bank Corporation was launched as the nation's first Internet-specialized bank on October 12, 2000. It provides the ultimate convenience of 24/7 service, as well as advantageous interest rates and fees. Having set its sights on becoming the Internet users' main bank, PayPay Bank Corporation, along with Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation and other stakeholders, is striving to be the model for 21st century banking, providing high convenience made possible by the Internet and the IT revolution.

Head Office: 6th Floor, Shinjuku-Mitsui Building, 1-1, Nishi-Shinjuku 2-chome, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo

Tel: 03-3344-5210

Customer Center: (Toll Free in Japan: 0120-369-074)

SMBC Loan Servicer Co., Ltd.

SMBC Loan Servicer began operation in October 1999 as a comprehensive servicer for consumer unit of SMBC group. We are primarily focusing on collecting non-performing loans originated by members of the SMBC group and made to individual borrowers. We acquired servicer rating from Standard & Poor's in April 2001 and are expanding our client base to include financial institutions outside the group.

Head Office: 16-9, Tsukiji 3-chome, Chuo-ku, Tokyo

Tel: 03-3546-310

SMBC Consulting Co., Ltd.

(Link to SMBC Consulting Co., Ltd. Website.)

SMBC Consulting provides high quality, useful information and service on business management through their various businesses.

<Major businesses of SMBC Consulting>

SMBC Management Club: We deliver selected business information to our clients through monthly letter, facsimile, website, e-mail, etc.

Management consulting: Our members are advised on various problems by lawyers, licensed tax accountants and CPAs, in addition to our staffs.

Seminars: In Tokyo and Osaka, we hold practical seminars on business management and development of human resources over 500 times each year.

Educational business: We help companies develop their human resources through assistance in planning and providing lecturers on in-house training programs.

In addition to the above, we hold various events such as SEC (The Second generation Executive Club), SMBC Management Seminar, SMBC Top Seminar, and SMBC breakfast meeting (Kansai area only).

Head Office: 3-4, Yaesu 1-chome, Chuo-ku, Tokyo

Tel: 03-5255-5551

Osaka office: Honmachi Koa Building, 6 Honmachi 3-chome, Chuo-ku, Osaka

Tel: 06-6251-2681

SMBC Business Servicing Co., Ltd.

SMBC Business Servicing was established in March 1999 to conduct servicing operations under Japan's Law Concerning Special Measures for Servicing Business (Servicer Law). We acquired rating from Standard & Poor's in October 2000 and are expanding our servicing business to include assets from financial institutions outside the SMBC group, as well as problem assets of SMBC group itself.

Head Office: Tsukiji Muromachi Building, 16-9, Tsukiji 3-chome, Chuo-ku, Tokyo

Tel: 03-3544-6004

Sakura Information Systems Co., Ltd.

(Link to Sakura Information Systems Co., Ltd. Website.)

Using the technical expertise and development capabilities gained in providing support for banking systems, Sakura Information Systems can assist you in building and operating open network systems as a network-oriented business solution provider.

Head Office: Sakura Meguro Building, 1-4, Kami-Osaki 4-chome, Shinagawa-ku, Tokyo

Tel: 03-5434-8511

Sakura K.C.S. Corporation (Listed on the Second Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange)

(Link to Sakura K.C.S. Corporation Website.)

Sakura K.C.S. has developed as a comprehensive information systems provider in a full spectrum of fields of finance, the public sector and industry, mainly offering systems integration and sales, and outsourcing services. Amid the rapid advancement and integration of IT and telecommunications, customer needs and expectations continue to grow and diversify. We offer IT consulting, network solutions, security solutions and other high value-added services that keep our customers abreast of the times.
